turns.text: ...well, see him?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Yeah, but he didn't see me.

turns.speaker: MARV
turns.text: Cheer up buddy buddy. You shook Gekko the Great's hand and you still got all your fingers. He's not the only elephant in the jungle.

turns.speaker: MARV
turns.text: ...got tickets for the Knicks tonight. Go out and cruise some bimbos afterwards, whaddaya say?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: ...gotta read my reports.

turns.speaker: MARV
turns.text: Forget charts! We're not fund managers, Bud, churn 'em and burn 'em. I'm offering you the Knicks and chicks. God save you before you turn into poor Steeples over there.

turns.speaker: MARV
turns.text: Nice guy but a loser. Lost all his equity when his firm went belly up in the recession of 71. you wanna be coming in here in your late sixties still pitching? ... Whatever happened to that cute analyst at Thudder, Wicks? ... Cindy? Susan?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Cindy. Having sex with her is like reading the Wall Street Journal 'cept the Journal don't talk back. 'Sides this AIDS crap is ruining romance, nobody trusts anybody anymore, gotta get a blood test in the toilet before you leave a bar together, somebody oughtta invent an AIDS dipstick, no kidding, make a fortune. I gotta get to work... Z's today.

turns.speaker: MARV
turns.text: Got a little action there, eh buddy?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Marv,  ...I just bagged the elephant!

turns.speaker: MARV
turns.text: Buddy, buddy, some buddy; why didn't you tell me to buy Bluestar.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Hey Marv, he demanded confidentiality...

turns.speaker: MARV
turns.text: Gimme a break. You buy Bluestar Airlines yesterday. Today they just happen to get good news and the stock goes bat shit. You must have ESP. A real Nostradamus.  Jesus Christ, what are friends for?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: All right, I owe you one Marv.

turns.speaker: MARV
turns.text: That's right, next time a little birdie talks to you, talk to me too E.F. Hutton.

turns.speaker: MARV
turns.text: What the hell...

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Anacott Steel. Buy it.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: MARV
turns.text: Lynch is giving him the boot... He's not pulling his quota.

turns.speaker: MARV
turns.text: Hey you hear the news. I just got a job at a new firm: "Dewey, Cheat 'em and Howe." Yuk yuk.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Didn't I tell you to knock before you came in here?

turns.speaker: MARV
turns.text: Hey the door was open.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Then get out and close it behind you.

turns.speaker: MARV
turns.text: You know what you need, buddy buddy--an optorectomy. That's when they cut the nerve that runs from your brain to your rectum--to change that shitty attitude of yours.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Get the hell out!

turns.speaker: MARV
turns.text: I agree. Go thou and sin no more.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: I want to make it up to you. Bluestar, put all your clients in it.

turns.speaker: MARV
turns.text: Thanks, buddy, buddy, I'm back. Say, Buddy, those optorectomies do work wonders.

turns.speaker: MARV
turns.text: The stock's going to Pluto!

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Start unloading.

turns.speaker: MARV
turns.text: Sell?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Now! Tell everyone to dump!

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: ...leave me alone willya. Only thing makes me feel good anymore. Spaghetti. She makes lousy spaghetti...

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: It's called pasta now Dad, spaghetti's out of date.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: ... looks like you grown another inch... but you don't look so hot, getting bags under your eyes, starting to look old like me.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Ah, I had a tough day. Some jerk D.K'd me and I gotta cover his loss.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Speak English will ya.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: D.K. -- didn't know -- who I was when the options he bought took a bath. He reneged on me.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: I told you not to go into that racket. You could've been a doctor or a lawyer,

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Coulda been a contender.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: you coulda stayed at Bluestar and been a supervisor in instead of going customer relations by now, 'stead of going off and bein' a salesman.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Look Dad, I'm not a salesman. How many times I gotta tell you I'm an account executive, and pretty soon I'm going to the investment banking side of the firm.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: You get on the phone and ask strangers for their money, right? You're a salesman.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Dad, it takes time. You gotta build a customer list. I'm doing it. I could make more money in one year as a broker than five years at the airline.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: I don't get it, you get a scholarship to NYU, you get 35,000 the first year, and 50 last year, where the hell is it?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: 50 K don't get you to first base in the Big Apple, Dad, not any more. I pay 40% in taxes, I got a rent of 15,000, I got school loans, car loans, food, park my car costs me 3 bills a month, I need good suits, that's $500 a pop, shoes...

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: So come home and live rent free, 'stead of that cockroach palace you live in. $50,000 Jesus Christ, the world is off its rocker. I made $37,000 last year and you...

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: It's Queens, Dad and a 5% mortgage and you rent the top room--I gotta live in Manhattan to be a player, Dad. There's no nobility in poverty anymore, y'know. One day you're going to be proud of me, you'll see...

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: It's yourself you've got to be proud of, Huckleberry, how much ya need?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Can you spare three hundred? Pay you back next month, promise.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: ...Got a 100 on me, you...

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Not in here Dad... please. Later.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: ... it adds up Buddy, 300 here, 200 there. Your brother never...  ...well, I always said money is something you need in case you don't die tomorrow...

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: How's Mom?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: ...same, pain in the ass, god bless her, talks too much... gonna take her to Florida next month... west coast, near Tampa, like to get out for good, but can't afford it.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: ...Work okay?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: ...this drug testing is driving my guys nuts. I got flagged for my blood pressure pills. The only good news is, we just met with the comptroller over some union stuff...'member that crash last summer? and the investigation? Well, the FAA is gonna rule it was a manufacturing flaw in the door latch mechanism. I kept telling 'em it wasn't maintenance, it was those goddamn greedy manufacturers out in Cincinnati. And I was right.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: That's great Dad.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Damn right, it gets us out from under suspension. We'll get those new routes to Pittsburgh and Boston and the equipment we need. We're gonna compete with the big boys now.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Hey to Bluestar, as your broker all I can advise is hold on to that stock Dad...

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: You sure about this FAA announcement?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: The FAA announcement.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Sure I'm sure. Buddy, you got that mischievous look in your eyes. You used to smile just like that when you were a baby sleeping, just like that.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: What brings you out here...

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Client. Got a private jet over at Butler Aviation... Dad, you always gotta light up when you see me, it's the...

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Don't start, alright.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Alright. Why so pissed?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Goddamn fare wars are murdering us. Had to lay off five guys. Nothing I could do. What is it... money?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Sure...lots of guys at the track talk like that... but how do you know you'll have any dough next month...  What's this? I gave you two hundred.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Dividend. I figure I owe you about five thousand in nickels and dimes...

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: ...don't be crazy. Put it to your school loans.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Don't worry about the loans. I'm doing good Dad and it's gonna stay that way now... least buy yourself a new suit.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: What do I need a fancy suit for. I don't hobnob with the jet set. I just fix their planes.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Problem with money is you never have enough or you got too much -- and when you got it you're never happy 'cause somebody's always trying to take it away from you. Money's one giant pain in the ass y'ask me... thanks.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: ... Dad, you should've been a CEO. How about dinner?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Whatever night you like.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Wait... next week's booked. Let me check with my girl and get back to you on Monday.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Yeah, you do that huckleberry. I'll still be here.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: ...gotta run Dad. You stop smoking, you hear?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Dad, you know Duncan Wilmore, pilot's union, and Toni Carpenter, flight attendants...

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: I met them before you were born.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: He's got your prick in his back pocket, son, and you're standing naked in the display window of Macy's. He's using you. Only you're too blind to see it.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: No, what I see is a jealous old machinist who can't stand that his son's become more successful than himself.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: What you see, son, is a man who never measured success by the size of a man's wallet.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: That's because you never had the guts to go out into the world and stake your claim.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Boy, if that's what you think, I must've really screwed up my job as a father.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: ...as far as being axed, I'm still here and as long as I am, I have a responsibility not just to me but to the union members I represent...

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Your responsibility, Dad, is to present the facts, not your opinions, to the men... you're gonna destroy their lives, Dad! Don't do it to 'em. Give it a chance. Let the membership decide for themselves, Dad. Please.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: I'll be damned that when my men come to me tomorrow morning, wanting to know what's going on, I'm going to lie to them!

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Your men! All my life "your men" have been able to count on you? Why is it that you've never been there for me?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Your words, not mine...

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: You speak for me, son.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Another cup of coffee?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: No, thanks, I'm nervous enough.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: I guess it's time to hit the road.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Yeah, don't want to be late for my own funeral.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Dad, I'm going to jail and you know it.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Maybe that's the price, Bud, maybe so. It's gonna be rough on you but maybe in some screwed up way, that's the best thing that can happen to you...stop trading for the quick buck and go produce something with your life, create, don't live off the buying and selling of others...

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Hello, Natalie, you recognize the voice? I'll give you a hint, you're thinking seriously about marrying me...

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: ...And you're even lovelier than I pictured. I brought a birthday present for Mr. Gekko.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: First of all, Mr. Fox, you can't just come barging in here. And what makes you think it's his birthday?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: It's in the bible, see. You better go buy him a present. Please, Natalie. Let me give him the gift; Cuban cigars--Davidoff, his favorite and hard to get.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Stay here, I'll see what I can do.

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: ...thanks Natalie.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: ...have a nice day Mr. Stone.  ... Mr. Gekko, the conference call is ready. Mr. Sugarman and Mr. Lorenzo in Delaware. Mr. Bernard in Los Angeles. Mr. Jackson and Ms. Rosco in London. They're all on.

turns.speaker: DIXON
turns.text: Sure, and I'm never gonna die either, is this one of your chain letter schemes or do I gotta buy a door to door cosmetic franchise in Northern Arkansas?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: No, no Dixon, my client wants to buy a large, large block of stock and needs to spread it around. I'll park some money in your account and if it hits, you get a big cut. I'm telling you, this is the easiest money you ever made...

turns.speaker: DIXON
turns.text: ...this guy who said he was from the Security Exchange Commission, whatever the hell that is, calls and wants to ask me about that stock I bought...

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: What'd you tell him?

turns.speaker: DIXON
turns.text: I told him I was in the bathroom and I'd call him right back. What the hell was I supposed to say Buddy, you got me into...

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Look Dixon, calm down! It's not illegal to buy stock or to be right. And it's not all that unusual to be spot checked on a big buy. Tell him you did your homework and you thought the stock was a sound investment.

turns.speaker: DIXON
turns.text: What if he asks where I got the money?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Tell 'em your father gave it to you.

turns.speaker: DIXON
turns.text: What if they call him?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: They won't. That's not their jurisdiction.

turns.speaker: DIXON
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Yes! Read the Constitution, it's all in there. And remember--you don't know anything, nothing.

turns.speaker: DIXON
turns.text: I don't know anything!

turns.speaker: BUD
turns.text: Good. Then call him back. And call me back. Don't worry.
